definition: horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
lit. fox's tail (idiom); visible sign of evil intentions/to reveal one's evil nature/evidence that reveals the villain
to leave loose ends/to leave matters unresolved
to obstruct/to be a drag on sb/to delay finishing off a job
rabbits don't have long tails (idiom)/its days are numbered/won't last long
pinyin: tu4 zi5 wei3 ba5 chang2 bu5 liao3

definition: to have one's tail between one's legs
to tuck one's tail between one's legs/fig. to back down/in a humiliating situation
lit. rat's tail; fig. a follower of inferior stature

sentences.english: We may call this phenomenon catching the lion by its tail, and it is an unskillful thing to do.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以稱之爲抓住獅子的尾巴，這是不善巧的。

sentences.english: FOX caught in a trap escaped, but in so doing lost his tail.
sentences.chinese: 一隻狐狸被捕獸器把尾巴夾斷了。

sentences.english: There was only one scorpion. But the sting was in the tail.
sentences.chinese: 只剩一隻蠍子了，但是刺卻在尾巴上。

sentences.english: Seismosaurus had a long neck, a small head and a long thin tail.
sentences.chinese: 地震龍長着長脖子，小腦袋，以及一條細長的尾巴。

sentences.english: Its scythe-like tail into the water, the fishing line to slide down quickly also.
sentences.chinese: 它那大鐮刀似的尾巴入水中後，釣絲也飛快地滑下去。

sentences.english: Voldemort throws Wormtail out of a window.
sentences.chinese: 老伏把蟲尾巴丟出窗戶。

sentences.english: The horse flicked the flies away with his tail.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬用尾巴拂去身上的蒼蠅。

sentences.english: Bear woke up with a start and pulled his long tail hard as he could.
sentences.chinese: 熊被驚醒過來，開始使勁地拉尾巴。
母牛颼地甩動它的尾巴。

sentences.english: But his tail had been caught in the ice which had frozen over during the night and as he pulled, it broke off : Whack!
sentences.chinese: 但是它的尾巴已經被牢牢地凍在冰裏了。

sentences.english: Chiefly British A hawk of the genus Buteo , having broad wings and a broad tail.
sentences.chinese: 屬的一種鷹，有寬大的翅膀和寬尾巴。

sentences.english: Candie's tail tells you something happened there.
sentences.chinese: 我的尾巴告訴你那邊有情況。

sentences.english: Debauchery of the tail of defects.
North American shrew with tail less than half its body length.
sentences.chinese: 北美洲鼩鼱，尾巴比其身體的一半還短。

sentences.english: A fox cannot hide its tail.

definition: to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
